meanings.definition: The act of constructing or assembling a structure or building.
meanings.sent1: The builddowns of the new house took several months to complete.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers were busy with the builddowns of the office building.
meanings.sent3: The builddowns of the Lego tower were interrupted by a playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like builddowns, carefully planned and steadily rising.
meanings.sent5: The builddowns of the sandcastle were a masterpiece of patience and precision.

meanings.definition: A decrease in the value or size of a building or structure.
meanings.sent1: The builddowns of the old factory were due to neglect and lack of maintenance.
meanings.sent2: The economic crisis led to builddowns in property prices across the city.
meanings.sent3: The builddowns of the gingerbread house were caused by a hungry visitor.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned mansion stood as a symbol of builddowns in the once prosperous town.
meanings.sent5: The builddowns of the bridge made it unsafe for crossing, prompting urgent repairs.
